definitions: marked by hidden dangers or hazards that catch one unaware
guilty of or involving betrayal or deception of trust
examples: The treacherous mountain path claimed several lives
Treacherous weather conditions forced them to cancel the expedition
His treacherous actions destroyed years of friendship
The treacherous advisor betrayed the king's secrets

definitions: constituting or characteristic of treason against one's country or sovereign
examples: The treasonous plot against the government was discovered
His treasonous activities led to his immediate arrest

definitions: regarded as precious and kept or guarded with great care and affection
examples: Her treasured family photographs survived the fire
These treasured memories will stay with me forever

definitions: subjected to a chemical or physical process to preserve or give properties
having received medical care or therapeutic attention for a condition
examples: The treated wood resists rot and insect damage
Treated wastewater can be safely released into rivers
The treated patients showed significant improvement
Only treated cases were included in the study

definitions: consisting of or amounting to three times the usual size or amount
relating to or denoting the highest part or range in music
examples: The company achieved treble profits this quarter
She won treble damages in the lawsuit
The treble voices of the children's choir filled the cathedral
Turn down the treble on your stereo system

definitions: having no trees; bare of trees in an area where they might grow
examples: The treeless landscape stretched endlessly before them
These treeless hills were once covered in forest

definitions: shaking or quivering slightly from fear, excitement, weakness, or cold
examples: Her trembling hands could barely hold the letter
The trembling puppy hid behind the sofa

definitions: very great in amount, scale, or intensity; enormous or immense
extremely good or impressive; extraordinary in excellence or achievement
examples: The earthquake caused tremendous damage to the city
They faced tremendous pressure to succeed
She did a tremendous job organizing the event
The team showed tremendous courage in the final moments

definitions: vigorous or incisive in expression or style; sharply perceptive and clear
examples: Her trenchant criticism of the policy sparked debate
The author's trenchant wit made the book memorable

definitions: very fashionable or up to date in style or influence; following trends
examples: The trendy restaurant was booked for weeks ahead
She always wears trendy clothes from boutique shops

definitions: entering someone's land or property without permission; unlawfully intruding
examples: The trespassing hikers were warned by security
Trespassing signs were posted around the perimeter

definitions: shaped like a triangle; having three angles and three sides
examples: The triangular sail caught the wind perfectly
She arranged the sandwiches in a triangular pattern

definitions: of, relating to, or characteristic of a tribe or tribes
examples: Tribal customs have been preserved for centuries
The tribal council made important community decisions

definitions: flowing into a larger stream or river as a smaller branch
examples: The tributary streams feed the main river system
Several tributary rivers join at this confluence

definitions: requiring care and skill because difficult or awkward to handle
intended to deceive or outwit someone through cleverness
examples: The tricky math problem took hours to solve
Parking in this narrow space is particularly tricky
He asked tricky questions to confuse the witness
Don't trust him with those tricky contract terms

definitions: having three colors, especially as arranged in stripes on a flag
examples: The tricolor flag waved proudly above the embassy
She wore a tricolor scarf in national colors

definitions: tested and proved to be reliable through experience or use
examples: She relied on tried methods that always worked
This tried formula has served the company well

definitions: taking place every three years; recurring at three-year intervals
examples: The triennial conference attracts delegates from worldwide
They conduct triennial reviews of all programs

definitions: unimportant or trivial; of very little value or significance
examples: Don't waste time on such trifling matters
The trifling sum barely covered their expenses

definitions: of or relating to trigonometry or its functions and calculations
examples: Students struggled with trigonometric equations this semester
The engineer used trigonometric calculations for the design

definitions: having three sides or involving three parties, countries, or groups
examples: The trilateral agreement benefited all three nations
They formed a trilateral commission to address concerns

definitions: able to speak three languages fluently; written or conducted in three languages
examples: The trilingual interpreter worked at international conferences
This trilingual dictionary includes English, French, and Spanish

definitions: amounting to or numbering one million million (or thousand billion)
examples: The national debt exceeded trillion dollar levels
Trillion dollar companies dominate the tech sector

definitions: neat, orderly, and in good condition; well-maintained and tidy
slim and fit; in good physical condition without excess weight
examples: The trim garden showed careful maintenance throughout
She kept her trim appearance despite the chaos
He maintained a trim figure through regular exercise
The trim athlete competed in multiple events

definitions: cut or clipped to achieve a neat shape or appearance
decorated or finished with contrasting material along the edges
examples: The neatly trimmed hedges lined the driveway
His trimmed beard gave him a professional look
Her trimmed coat had elegant fur along the collar
The trimmed curtains matched the room's decor

definitions: consisting of three parts; shared by or involving three parties
examples: The tripartite agreement settled the territorial dispute
Their tripartite structure divided power equally

definitions: consisting of three parts, things, or aspects combined
three times as much or as many as usual
examples: The triple alliance changed the political landscape
She won a triple crown in the competition
Triple portions were served at the celebration feast
The company reported triple profits this year

definitions: having three parts or elements; threefold in structure or arrangement
examples: The triplex apartment spanned three floors
They installed triplex glass for better insulation

definitions: moving with quick light steps in a lively or nimble way
examples: The tripping rhythm of the dance delighted audiences
Children came tripping down the path together

definitions: lacking in freshness or effectiveness due to constant use; hackneyed
examples: His trite expressions bored the sophisticated audience
The movie relied on trite plot devices

definitions: relating to or celebrating a great victory or achievement
examples: The triumphal arch commemorated the military victory
His triumphal return home drew massive crowds

definitions: having won a battle or contest; victorious and successful
feeling or expressing jubilation after having won or succeeded
examples: The triumphant team celebrated on the field
Her triumphant return marked the campaign's success
His triumphant smile showed his satisfaction
She raised her arms in triumphant celebration

definitions: consisting of three in one; being three yet unified
examples: The triune nature of the deity is central
Their triune partnership controlled the entire market

definitions: of very little importance or value; insignificant or commonplace
examples: Don't bother me with such trivial complaints
The difference between them was trivial

definitions: relating to feeding and nutrition, especially in ecological food chains
examples: Scientists studied trophic levels in the ecosystem
Trophic relationships determine energy flow in nature

definitions: of, typical of, or peculiar to the tropics or tropical regions
examples: The tropic climate supports diverse plant life
Tropic birds migrate seasonally between hemispheres

definitions: of, typical of, or peculiar to the tropics as a geographic region
resembling the tropics, especially in being very hot and humid
examples: Tropical rainforests contain incredible biodiversity
They studied tropical diseases affecting local populations
The tropical heat made outdoor work difficult
This tropical weather in September is unusual

definitions: beset by problems or conflict; experiencing difficulties or turmoil
showing distress or anxiety; worried and disturbed in mind
examples: The troubled company filed for bankruptcy protection
These troubled waters require careful navigation
Her troubled expression revealed inner turmoil
He had a troubled sleep filled with nightmares

definitions: causing difficulty, annoyance, or inconvenience; problematic and burdensome
examples: The troublesome engine required constant repairs
These troublesome regulations slow down our progress

definitions: causing distress, worry, or concern; disturbing to one's peace of mind
examples: The troubling news affected everyone's mood
These troubling symptoms require immediate medical attention

definitions: absent from school without leave or explanation; playing truant
examples: The truant students were caught at the mall
Truant officers patrol areas where students gather

definitions: in accordance with fact or reality; not false or erroneous
genuine, real, or actual; not artificial or counterfeit
loyal, faithful, and steadfast in allegiance or affection
examples: The true story inspired millions of readers
Her prediction turned out to be true
This is true leather, not synthetic material
He showed his true character under pressure
She remained a true friend through difficult times
He was true to his principles

definitions: shortened by having the end or top cut off
examples: The truncate pyramid had a flat top
These truncate leaves are characteristic of the species

definitions: shortened by having a part cut off or omitted; abbreviated
examples: The truncated version omitted important details
His truncated speech disappointed the waiting audience

definitions: regarded as reliable, truthful, or dependable; having earned confidence
examples: She consulted her trusted advisor before deciding
Only trusted employees have access to sensitive data

definitions: showing or tending to have a belief in reliability and honesty of others
examples: Her trusting nature made her vulnerable to deception
The trusting child believed everything adults told him

definitions: able to be relied on as honest, truthful, or reliable; deserving confidence
examples: The trustworthy employee handled large sums of money
She proved herself trustworthy through years of service

definitions: reliable, dependable, and loyal, especially through long service
examples: His trusty companion never left his side
She grabbed her trusty umbrella before leaving

definitions: telling or expressing the truth; honest and not containing lies
examples: The witness gave truthful testimony under oath
Children should be encouraged to be truthful

definitions: difficult or annoying; hard to endure due to stress or irritation
examples: It has been a trying day with endless problems
These trying circumstances test everyone's patience
